body_html:
With vs2015 only supporting the cuda toolkit 8.0 you'd need to use vs2013.
The c99 support in vs2013 was incomplete and tensorflow makes lots of use of c99. When we started porting tensorflow we used vs2015.update1 and even that was a royal pain to get things compile - lots of little things that required code changes. With vs2015.update3 all of this went away.
Maybe not impossible to get this to work but it would be very painful. The code changes itself would be somewhat hard to push back into the master because there would be lots of ifdef.
If you need 7.5 on the box and can't install the cuda 8.0 you could try to copy the cuda 8.0 dlls into a directory and make sure tensorflow finds that directory in the path before it finds 7.5 dlls. As long you have the latest nvidia driver I think this should work.

The c99 support in vs2013 was incomplete and tensorflow makes lots of use of c99. When we started porting tensorflow we used vs2015.update1 and even that was a royal pain to get things compile - lots of little things that required code changes. With vs2015.update3 all of this went away.
Maybe not impossible to get this to work but it would be very painful. The code changes itself would be somewhat hard to push back into the master because there would be lots of ifdef.
